questiontext.text:
\(\begin{aligned} A & = \left \{ x \mid x = 2k, k \in Z \right \}\\ B & = \left \{ x \mid x = 2k + 1, k \in Z \right \}\\ C & = \left \{ x \mid x = 2(k + 1), k \in Z \right \}\\ D & = \left \{ x \mid x = 2k - 1, k \in Z \right \} \end{aligned}\)

where Z is the set of all the integers (positive and negative) numbers, including 0. If each time two sets make a cross section then which one yields an empty set?

answer.text: \(A \cap B = \varnothing, A \cap C = \varnothing, C \cap B = \varnothing, C \cap D = \varnothing\)

feedback.text: \(A \cap B = \varnothing, A \cap C = \varnothing, C \cap B = \varnothing, C \cap D = \varnothing\): Correct

answer.text: \(A \cap D = \varnothing, A \cap C = \varnothing, C \cap B = \varnothing, C \cap D = \varnothing\)

feedback.text: \(A \cap D = \varnothing, A \cap C = \varnothing, C \cap B = \varnothing, C \cap D = \varnothing\): Incorrect

answer.text: \(A \cap B = \varnothing, A \cap C = \varnothing, B \cap D = \varnothing, C \cap B = \varnothing\)

feedback.text: \(A \cap B = \varnothing, A \cap C = \varnothing, B \cap D = \varnothing, C \cap B = \varnothing\): Incorrect

answer.text: \(A \cap B = \varnothing, A \cap D = \varnothing, C \cap B = \varnothing, C \cap D = \varnothing\)

feedback.text: \(A \cap B = \varnothing, A \cap D = \varnothing, C \cap B = \varnothing, C \cap D = \varnothing\): Incorrect
